page.title: 08 Glen Laragain: Forestry 2
page.content: {Tree Harvest} The trees will be harvested in stages. The first crop from a plantation is not usually ready for harvesting until the trees have been growing for about twenty years. The timber from this crop will be used to make paper and chipboard which is used in the manufacture of modern furniture. A second and third crop can be harvested as the trees grow bigger, and eventually reach maturity. At this stage the trees will have been growing for at least thirty years. The trees will then be sold to a sawmill which will saw the timber into boards for house building and furniture making.
